reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Ritz and had a very nice stay. We had an executive suite which had plenty of room for us (2 adults, 2 young children). The room was clean and had decent fixtures (tv's were dated). We also had club privlages, even though we were not on the club floor. The service was excellent during our stay. Everybody was friendly and professional. The hotel is in a central Phoenix location and access to main roads is a breeze. The hotel was clean, except for the pool area which had cigarette butts all around it (hard to criticize the hotel and not the disgusting, thoughtless cigarette smokers). The pool was odd in that it was so small. You would think they would expand it ? The misters were nice, when they were on. One note on the club level - it was mediocre compared to other Ritz club levels in terms of presentation and decor (not bad, just not the best).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Good Location!
reviews.text: This Ritz is well located on Camelback in Phoenix. for what tht's worth, Camelback is an endless array of shopping malls. The value to that is that you can drop your rental car there without getting hammered by the hotel valet.

The rooms and foyer to the Ritz have a slightly off-putting faux-European feel to it which is an odd motif for a desert city. Nevertheless, the rooms are vastly discounted to under $100 in the height of the heat. The hotel is in easy proximity to several decent restaurants and lounges. The rooms are small but clean with extras and it's quiet.
reviews.title: A so-so, worn-out Ritz

reviews.text: Further, if you know just a little of Phoenix, it's a nearly straight shoot from the airport rental car to Camelback, giving tourists easy access to this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in boring location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ritz for a business trip and left quite underwhelmed. The lobby is beautiful, the service was great, but the room itself was disappointing and in need of a makeover. The furniture was worn and starting to look a bit beaten up, the towels were thin and worn, the bathroom showed signs of rust in various places, the bathtub's coating was peeling in several spots, the TV was old and didn't work very well, and the room service food was nothing special. I expected much, much more from a Ritz property.
reviews.title: Phoenix Ritz is nothing Special

reviews.text: The Ritz Phoenix was a great hotel with outstanding Ritz Service. The hotel is located outside of downtown Phoenix near an upscale mall, suburban office buildings and upscale chain restuarants nearby, Morton's, Houston's, Capital Grill etc. The room was pleasant and average for a Ritz. The toilet in my bathroom ran but was fine with the door closed. Valet parking was $24/night and I did not see anyplace where I could self-park. Overall, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Service
Expected more...
reviews.text: I spent one night at this hotel with my wife on our way back from Sedona (Stayed at Adobe Grand Villa, loved it!) and was kind of disappointed. I have stayed at the Ritz at Laguna Nigel and was really unimpressed with this resort. Here are my thoughts...

Room: The bed was comfortable as expected. However, the furniture in the rooms looked old and worn out. Also the A/C and heater unit kept malfunctioning. The heater would come on at the wrong time and the room became all toasty. We called the front desk who sent a repair man to fix it. They stated that the fuse needed to be changed.
reviews.title: Solid choice for a non-resort

likes.liked: — Location, Beds to die for, good staff

reviews.title: Classic Elegance
reviews.text: Amenity: The workout room was very small. They crammed a bunch of tredmills next to some free weights. It was kind of cramped

Service: They were kind enough to wave our parking fee after I complained about the heater. However, my wife left her favorite pillow there and we asked them to ship it back. They offered to do it for $30. I thought that was kind of absurd.
reviews.title: An Excellent Return Stay

reviews.text: Lovely hotel, beautiful lobby. Rooms nice, clean and plenty of coffee, tea, soaps, lotions. Dissappointing pool and work out room. Pool roof top , square and boxy and fitness area small and tight. Hotel across the street from nice outdoor mall with nice dining. The beds are luxurious, fluffy and beautiful. I loved the robe and slippers, I felt like a queen.
reviews.title: Bad pool for a swanky hotel

reviews.text: The Ritz Carlton provided excellent service and a comfortable, but nothing special, room at an expensive price. The only word that I can think of for our room and bathroom is "standard". Don't stay here if you're looking for a hotel stay that will "wow" you. I always thought the Ritz should stand out as special, but it doesn't here. The bar had a great atmosphere, very country club feel, with excellent service.
reviews.title: We give the bar an A+, the rooms just a B

likes.liked: — The location is nice-right across the street from excellent shopping!

reviews.text: We stayed March 15-18 and this was our second vist here. I like the hotel and love Ritz Carltons - we try to stay at them wherever they are, unless there is a property that interests us more. I like the location, which is central, and love the proximity to shopping and restaurants. My husband attended a cardiac conference and the hotel handled that meeting well he thought -- it was not a large meeting.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our second stay here

likes.liked: — Lobby bar, nice rooms with great bedding, turndown service, Ritz amenities
likes.disliked: — Small pool and fitness rooms, not enough staff at pool

reviews.text: I do wish the pool was larger, and that there was more than one person on duty to help with towels and get drinks. Also there aren't enough chairs -- that becomes a problem when you've got a full house and folks looking to spend some time outside - we had gorgeous weather and while my husband golfed I took the opportunity to relax in the sun after a full morning of emptying his wallet.
reviews.title: Disapponited

likes.disliked: — expensive for what you get. club level not worth the extra $$$

reviews.title: Fortress Phoenix: The Weakest Link in the Ritz Carlton Empire?
reviews.text: The fitness room is small and I found the treadmills full each morning, but was so glad to be able to run outside as there are plenty of safe routes. I especially loved that jasmine was blooming everywhere and that heavenly scent was worth running outside in that gorgeous dry morning air.
The service and the food is fantastic The rooms are clean (a little dated), but the service and the staff are impeccable!!
reviews.title: Great place for an upscale business conference or a restful stay!!!!

reviews.text: We have meetings at Ritz-Carltons all over the country and the Ritz-Carlton Phoenix offers incredible attention to detail. The staff could not have been more accomodating and the food presentations were outstanding. You can tell how well a hotel is run by the way the staff at every level meets or exceeds your every need.
reviews.title: Yup, It's a Ritz (except the fitness center)

reviews.text: Group attendees and those in our membershp who have visited Phoenix and stayed in this hotel raved about the calibre of service over and over. We gave the Ritz-Carlton, Phoenix a try and we will be back again. Hats off to General Manager, Peter Ells and his fine staff.
reviews.title: OK, But I Have Been At Better RC's

reviews.text: Have stayed in Ritz/Four Seasons properties in several cities and this one followed in line; prompt service, individualized welcome card upon check-in (not that I need that kind of thing), clean, comfortable room and beds - and the requisite Ferraris, Porshes and Escalades parked front and center with the valet. We had a ton of luggage including musical equipment, and the bellhops were attentive and luggage was in our room less than 10 mins after check-in. Was a little disappointed in the fitness center - more along the lines of something you'd find at a Hyatt, but still decent. Close to shops, etc. Still ticks me off that the Ritz and other 4/5 star hotels charge an extra $10 for internet access, but guess most are just expensing it through on business accounts anyway, but just include it in the room rate - I can get "free" access at Best Westerns!!! Overall, you'll definitely know it's a Ritz.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: I am currently staying at the RC Phoenix as the hotel where I am attending business meetings was full. For a corporate rate of $169/night, it's not bad. If I was paying more, I would be very dissappointed. I have been at RC's in San Francisco, Half Moon Bay, and Chicago, and this one does not compare. The bathroom is showing its age and overall the rooms just feel old. The pool is tiny, the valet charge of $24/night for parking is insane, and the $10/night fee for Internet access is ridiculous.
reviews.title: Loved the Ritz! The Best staff ever!
